Others: The match served as the final Copa América tune-up for Canada.
Canada conceded three goals in 13 minutes after a goalless first half in a 4-0 loss to No. 7 Netherlands on Thursday.
Alphonso Davies put a free kick from 26 yards out off the France wall in the 65th minute.
Davies then sent a cross in front of the net intended for Toronto FC midfielder Jonathan Osorio, but it was intercepted by a sliding William Saliba.
Randal Kolo Muani latched onto a Kingsley Coman cross, but his downward header in second-half stoppage time was wide of the net.
New Real Madrid signing Kylian Mbappé nearly won it at the death for France, but Portland Timbers goalkeeper Max Crepeau made a diving save to preserve the 0-0 draw.
Canada featured seven current MLS players, including the debut of Minnesota United forward Tani Oluwaseyi off the bench.
